Thank you so much to everyone who made this possible, it's been so fun to work on this project! :)

Thank you so much to everyone who made this possible, it's been so fun to work on this project! :)

originContent: # EchoCLI
translatedContent: # EchoCLI

originContent: A tethered root solution for your echo dot 2nd generation.
translatedContent: A tethered root solution for your echo dot 2nd generation.

originContent: To start, run `main.py`
translatedContent: To start, run `main.py`

originContent:
[ 
 How does this work? 
 ](https://dragon863.github.io/blog/echoroot.html)
translatedContent:
[ 
 How does this work? 
 ](https://dragon863.github.io/blog/echoroot.html)

originContent: ## Notice
translatedContent: ## Notice

originContent: - Due to software updates being pushed constantly, I cannot guarantee that this will work for your echo. If you encounter any issues, feel free to contact me, and if you find a bug pull requests are welcome.
translatedContent: - Due to software updates being pushed constantly, I cannot guarantee that this will work for your echo. If you encounter any issues, feel free to contact me, and if you find a bug pull requests are welcome.

originContent: - It is **strongly** recommended that you run this on a linux machine, as I am unable to test it on Windows and there is no guarantee that Windows-specific bugs are not present
translatedContent: - It is **strongly** recommended that you run this on a linux machine, as I am unable to test it on Windows and there is no guarantee that Windows-specific bugs are not present

originContent: > **Warning**
translatedContent: > **Warning**

originContent: > **This is a TETHERED root solution** It is _recommended_ to block amazon's OTA servers (https://d1s31zyz7dcc2d.cloudfront.net and https://d1s31zyz7dcc2d.cloudfront.prod.ota-cloudfront.net) to prevent updates from corrupting or removing root on your device. I am not responsible for any damage to your device
translatedContent: > **This is a TETHERED root solution** It is _recommended_ to block amazon's OTA servers (https://d1s31zyz7dcc2d.cloudfront.net and https://d1s31zyz7dcc2d.cloudfront.prod.ota-cloudfront.net) to prevent updates from corrupting or removing root on your device. I am not responsible for any damage to your device

originContent: ## Features
translatedContent: ## Features

originContent: - Rooted ADB shell over USB or Wi-Fi
translatedContent: - Rooted ADB shell over USB or Wi-Fi

originContent: - Record audio from device
translatedContent: - Record audio from device

originContent: - Use your Echo as an indicator for Home Assistant without internet
translatedContent: - Use your Echo as an indicator for Home Assistant without internet

originContent: - Restore your device to factory configuration
translatedContent: - Restore your device to factory configuration

originContent: ## Install
translatedContent: ## Install

originContent: - This project requires python 3.
translatedContent: - This project requires python 3.

originContent: - I recommend using linux for running this program. Please ensure you have disabled ModemManager if you have it installed.
translatedContent: - I recommend using linux for running this program. Please ensure you have disabled ModemManager if you have it installed.

originContent: Install requirements using `pip`:
translatedContent: Install requirements using `pip`:

originContent: ```sh
translatedContent: ```sh

originContent: pip install -r requirements.txt
translatedContent: pip install -r requirements.txt

originContent: - You will also require fastboot and ADB, there is a good guide on how to install these [here](https://wiki.lineageos.org/adb_fastboot_guide). After downloading these you can set the executable path in the config.json file.
translatedContent: - You will also require fastboot and ADB, there is a good guide on how to install these [here](https://wiki.lineageos.org/adb_fastboot_guide). After downloading these you can set the executable path in the config.json file.

originContent: - Please ensure that the micro USB cable you use to connect your echo dot is a data cable and not a power-only variant.
translatedContent: - Please ensure that the micro USB cable you use to connect your echo dot is a data cable and not a power-only variant.

originContent: ## Documentation
translatedContent: ## Documentation

originContent: You can find how this tool works on [my website](https://dragon863.github.io/blog/echoroot.html).
translatedContent: You can find how this tool works on [my website](https://dragon863.github.io/blog/echoroot.html).

originContent: Once you have rooted the device, a file called `preloader_no_hdr.bin` will be generated. To boot the device, you will need to install [mtkclient](https://github.com/bkerler/mtkclient), copy the file into its directory and run `python mtk plstage --ptype=kamakiri2 --preloader=preloader_no_hdr.bin`. Replace `python` with `python3` depending on the python version you have installed.
translatedContent: Once you have rooted the device, a file called `preloader_no_hdr.bin` will be generated. To boot the device, you will need to install [mtkclient](https://github.com/bkerler/mtkclient), copy the file into its directory and run `python mtk plstage --ptype=kamakiri2 --preloader=preloader_no_hdr.bin`. Replace `python` with `python3` depending on the python version you have installed.

originContent: ## Home assistant indicator
translatedContent: ## Home assistant indicator

originContent: When using the home assistant indicator feature, I would recommend using a raspberry pi zero w or other small SBC to run the python flask server, and boot the device. You can use crontab to make this happen automatically on boot using mtkclient.
translatedContent: When using the home assistant indicator feature, I would recommend using a raspberry pi zero w or other small SBC to run the python flask server, and boot the device. You can use crontab to make this happen automatically on boot using mtkclient.

originContent: ## Bricked your echo?
translatedContent: ## Bricked your echo?

originContent: Follow the guide [here](https://github.com/Dragon863/EchoCLI/blob/main/debrick.md) to use mtkclient for unbricking a rooted or partially rooted echo
translatedContent: Follow the guide [here](https://github.com/Dragon863/EchoCLI/blob/main/debrick.md) to use mtkclient for unbricking a rooted or partially rooted echo
